title: Mercury square Mars
summary: A high-friction alignment between thinking and impulse. Thoughts accelerate faster than judgment, increasing the risk of reactive speech and rushed decisions. The task is to slow cognition enough to stay precise.

meaning.headline: Speed without pause can turn insight into noise.

frames.text: Mercury–Mars squares heighten mental urgency, making ideas feel immediate and action feel necessary—even when clarity isn’t complete.
Reactivity increases when thoughts are acted on before they’re fully formed.
Conversations may feel sharper or more confrontational if pacing isn’t managed.
Quick problem-solving is possible, but it benefits from restraint.
This guarantees arguments or verbal conflict.

opportunities: Identifying where impatience is driving decisions
Channeling sharp thinking into focused problem-solving
Turning agitation into decisive but measured action

do: Pause before responding, especially in charged conversations.
Write or outline thoughts before acting on them.
Channel excess mental energy into structured tasks.
Ask questions instead of making assumptions.
Slow the conversation down if stakes are high.
avoid: Reacting to every thought as if it needs action
Using sharp language to feel in control

reusable_lines.text: Speed is useful only when it’s controlled.

allowed_framing: Agency-based framing: 'you can slow this down…'

sources: Mercury–Mars square as thought/impulse tension archetype
